content:
• Monday, February 6, 2012
  • SBH

    Sally Beauty (NYSE:SBH) falls 2.8% AH after filing to sell 20M shares held by CDRS Acquisition,...

    Sally Beauty (NYSE:SBH) falls 2.8% AH after filing to sell 20M shares held by CDRS Acquisition, which currently owns 35.2% of all outstanding shares. Following the sale, CDRS' stake will be in the range of 25%.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:41 PM
  • CBM

    More on Cambrex (NYSE:CBM): Q4 beats on revenue but misses on a per share basis, as income from...

    More on Cambrex (NYSE:CBM): Q4 beats on revenue but misses on a per share basis, as income from continuing operations came in at $3M, or $0.10 per share, down from $0.18 per share during the same period in 2010. The company also expects 2012 sales should rise between 2% - 6% over 2011 levels, in line with analyst expectations. Shares -2.4% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:39 PM
  • OMI

    More on Owens & Minor (NYSE:OMI): Q4 beat slightly on revenue on a 9.9% Y/Y increase in net...

    More on Owens & Minor (NYSE:OMI): Q4 beat slightly on revenue on a 9.9% Y/Y increase in net profit. The company also boosts its dividend 10% to $0.22 per share. Shares -4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:24 PM
  • IBM

    More on Kenexa's Q4: Deferred revenue was $88.8M, up just 2% from Q3. The company expects Q1...

    More on Kenexa's Q4: Deferred revenue was $88.8M, up just 2% from Q3. The company expects Q1 revenue of $78M-$79M and EPS of $0.15-$0.17, compared with a consensus of $76.9M and $0.22. It expects 2012 revenue of $352M-$362M and EPS of $0.95-$1.07, compared with a consensus of $331.1M and $1.07. Top-line guidance is boosted by the acquisition of cloud e-learning software firm OutStart. KNXA -10.9% AH. TLEO -2.1%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:56 PM
  • VSAT

    ViaSat (NASDAQ:VSAT): Q4 EPS of $0.26 in-line. Revenue of $205M (+4.6% Y/Y) misses by $21M....

    ViaSat (NASDAQ:VSAT): Q4 EPS of $0.26 in-line. Revenue of $205M (+4.6% Y/Y) misses by $21M. Shares -1.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:55 PM
  • IDCC

    InterDigital (NASDAQ:IDCC) issues a downbeat forecast for FQ1 revenue, saying the projection...

    InterDigital (NASDAQ:IDCC) issues a downbeat forecast for FQ1 revenue, saying the projection reflected a shift in market share. It now expects to earn $69M in revenue, below street expectations for revenue of $77M. Shares -4.1% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:51 PM
  • PMCS

    More on PMC-Sierra (NASDAQ:PMCS): Q4 EPS comes in line but misses on revenue. Earnings more than...

    More on PMC-Sierra (NASDAQ:PMCS): Q4 EPS comes in line but misses on revenue. Earnings more than doubled as the chip maker booked a big tax recovery, but revenue declined 12% from Q3 and 4% Y/Y due to lower sales growth. Shares -6.5% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:34 PM
  • LNCR

    Lincare (NASDAQ:LNCR): Q4 EPS of $0.51 in-line. Revenue of $492.2M (+16.6% Y/Y) beats by $9M....

    Lincare (NASDAQ:LNCR): Q4 EPS of $0.51 in-line. Revenue of $492.2M (+16.6% Y/Y) beats by $9M. Shares -2.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:30 PM
  • IBM

    Kenexa (KNXA): Q4 EPS of $0.27 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $79.6M (+24.2% Y/Y) beats by $2.3M....

    Kenexa (KNXA): Q4 EPS of $0.27 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $79.6M (+24.2% Y/Y) beats by $2.3M. Shares -10.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:19 PM
  • CBM

    Cambrex (NYSE:CBM): Q4 EPS of $0.10 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $67.1M (+4.1% Y/Y) beats by...

    Cambrex (NYSE:CBM): Q4 EPS of $0.10 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $67.1M (+4.1% Y/Y) beats by $2.2M. Shares -2.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:56 PM
  • NCR

    In tandem with its Q4 report, NCR says it's selling its DVD kiosk business to Coinstar's Redbox...

    In tandem with its Q4 report, NCR says it's selling its DVD kiosk business to Coinstar's Redbox for $100M. Taking into account the sale, NCR expects 2012 revenue growth of 7%-9% and EPS of $2.36-$2.43; the latter is well above a $2.18 consensus. NCR +7.7% AH. CSTR +10.7%. (PR) (more on CSTR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:56 PM
  • RATE

    Bankrate (NYSE:RATE): Q4 EPS of $0.19 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $113.8M (+47.2% Y/Y) beats by...

    Bankrate (NYSE:RATE): Q4 EPS of $0.19 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $113.8M (+47.2% Y/Y) beats by $10M. Shares -4.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:53 PM
  • VECO

    More on Veeco's Q4: Though bookings rose 8% Q/Q thanks to a surge in hard drive equipment...

    More on Veeco's Q4: Though bookings rose 8% Q/Q thanks to a surge in hard drive equipment orders, the company's book-to-bill ratio was a mere 0.75, thanks to a 40% Q/Q drop in LED and solar equipment orders. Veeco expects Q1 revenue of $115M-$140M and EPS of $0.14-$0.34, below a consensus of $153.9M and $0.41. It warns LED orders could be depressed for multiple quarters. VECO -6.3% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM
  • FIO

    Heavily-shorted Fusion-io (FIO +11%) closes up strong after investors decide EMC's (EMC -0.5%)...

    Heavily-shorted Fusion-io (FIO +11%) closes up strong after investors decide EMC's (EMC -0.5%) VFCache product is more bark than bite. Fusion-io CEO David Flynn declares VFCache, which EMC used a Q&A call to promote, to be far more costly than Fusion-io's solutions, and deems it an attempt to hide the inadequacy of EMC's traditional SAN storage hardware for high-end performance needs.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM
  • KELYA

    Citigroup raises its rating to Buy from Neutral on Kelly Services (KELYA +6.1%), noting the...

    Citigroup raises its rating to Buy from Neutral on Kelly Services (KELYA +6.1%), noting the stock pulled back on what the firm views as "decent fourth-quarter results" and improving core margins (Q4 earnings). The firm also raises its estimates slightly based on KELYA's improving staffing data.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • BB

    Looks like Research In Motion (RIMM -1.8%) has lost another client, as Halliburton (NYSE:HAL)...

    Looks like Research In Motion (RIMM -1.8%) has lost another client, as Halliburton (NYSE:HAL) reportedly is phasing out employee BlackBerrys and phasing in iPhones and Apple's (AAPL +0.8%) iOS platform. BlackBerrys have been a staple for HAL's employees for more than 10 years. For Apple, it's further confirmation that it will compete for large corporate accounts.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM
  • MDSO

    Medidate Solutions (MDSO -8.1%) gets hit by a Jefferies downgrade to Hold, citing overly zealous...

    Medidate Solutions (MDSO -8.1%) gets hit by a Jefferies downgrade to Hold, citing overly zealous Street estimates and organic revenue growth hurdles in the year ahead.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 PM
  • DNR

    Denbury Resources (DNR +2.8%) says it ended 2011 with 16% more total proved oil and natural gas...

    Denbury Resources (DNR +2.8%) says it ended 2011 with 16% more total proved oil and natural gas reserves than a year earlier, due to increased drilling activity in the Bakken shale, and its acquisition of the Riley Ridge natural gas and carbon dioxide project in Wyoming.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:23 PM
  • KBH

    Raymond James cut five homebuilder stocks today on valuation after the sector's significant...

    Raymond James cut five homebuilder stocks today on valuation after the sector's significant outperformance in recent months amid the seasonal "Hope Trade," citing concerns of a disappointing spring selling season. It downgrades KB Home (KBH -3.2%) and Ryland Group (RYL -1.1%) to Underperform, and Lennar (LEN -2.9%), Toll Brothers (TOL -2.1%) and PulteGroup (PHM -0.5%) to Market Perform.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:04 PM
  • BBY

    Did Best Buy (BBY +2.7%) just leak details of Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) iTV, and will it get into...

    Did Best Buy (BBY +2.7%) just leak details of Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) iTV, and will it get into trouble for doing so? In a customer survey, BBY offers details of an "Apple HDTV" to be sold at stores for $1499: 42-inch 1080p LED flat panel display; can download and use App Store apps; supports iCloud for storing videos and music; can stream content from popular sites such as Netflix, YouTube, Flickr. (earlier)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM | 18 Comments
  • CYOU

    Disappointing guidance (I, II) from Sohu.com (SOHU -14.5%) and majority-owned online game...

    Disappointing guidance (I, II) from Sohu.com (SOHU -14.5%) and majority-owned online game developer Changyou.com (CYOU -12%) takes a toll on some recently high-flying Chinese Internet stocks. SINA -5.9%. BIDU -2%. RENN -4.4%. Bucking the trend, interestingly, is gaming concern Perfect World (PWRD +6.2%), perhaps out of a belief that Sohu/Changyou's loss is Perfect World's gain.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:41 PM
  • GSM

    Globe Specialty Metals (GSM +1.6%) moves up after its FQ2 beats estimates despite slowing Q/Q...

    Globe Specialty Metals (GSM +1.6%) moves up after its FQ2 beats estimates despite slowing Q/Q sales. Shipments dropped 5% from the previous quarter, largely because of reduced production from its Bridgeport, Alabama plant due to a fire plus planned maintenance and upgrades on six other furnaces.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:39 PM
  • KCP

    Kenneth Cole (KCP +2.2%) moves up after Sterne Agee upgrades the shares to Buy, noting that...

    Kenneth Cole (KCP +2.2%) moves up after Sterne Agee upgrades the shares to Buy, noting that product improvements and a better distribution strategy are likely starting to bear fruit in H2.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM
  • BKS

    Barnes & Noble (BKS +3.9%) rallies after an ITC staff attorney says he will recommend a...

    Barnes & Noble (BKS +3.9%) rallies after an ITC staff attorney says he will recommend a commission judge find that B&N didn't infringe any of the three patents asserted by Microsoft (MSFT -0.7%) in an infringement claim. The judge's ruling is due on April 27. A loss by Microsoft could put some of its lucrative Android licensing deals at risk. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:55 PM
  • KSWS

    K-Swiss (KSWS +5.7%) gets a boost from an upgrade to Neutral from Sterne Agee this morning,...

    K-Swiss (KSWS +5.7%) gets a boost from an upgrade to Neutral from Sterne Agee this morning, saying that near-term performance still looks challenging, but recently implemented cost controls and product improvements may be just what the company needs to end its slump.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM
  • WBA

    Shares of Walgreen (WAG +2.3%) perk up on word that the Express Scripts-Medco merger could be...

    Shares of Walgreen (WAG +2.3%) perk up on word that the Express Scripts-Medco merger could be blocked. Traders see a slimmer Express Scripts as more likely to work out a prescription deal with Walgreen.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:39 PM
  • ESRX

    Shares of Express Scripts (ESRX -4.2%)and Medco (MHS -8.8%) sink off of a report that the FTC is...

    Shares of Express Scripts (ESRX -4.2%)and Medco (MHS -8.8%) sink off of a report that the FTC is gathering evidence to use in a bid to block a deal between the companies to merge. A final decision on whether or not to sue is expected from the agency by end of February or early in March.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:34 PM | 2 Comments
  • FNF

    Fidelity National Financial (FNF -1.1%) could purchase even more restaurant companies after...

    Fidelity National Financial (FNF -1.1%) could purchase even more restaurant companies after snapping up O'Charley's with capital stored away from the sales of insurance assets, according to CEO George Scanlon. "The restaurant business can scale pretty quickly, and there are clearly cost benefits to being bigger, particularly on the purchasing side."

     
     
     
     
    | 1:25 PM
  • CNA

    CNA Financial (CNA -2.4%) beats Q4 estimates but trades lower after postig a 37% Y/Y decline in...

    CNA Financial (CNA -2.4%) beats Q4 estimates but trades lower after postig a 37% Y/Y decline in profit on wider operating losses in its non-core life and group business lines.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:09 PM
  • SYY

    Sysco (SYY -5.2%) trades lower despite beating FQ2 estimates earlier this morning, as investors...

    Sysco (SYY -5.2%) trades lower despite beating FQ2 estimates earlier this morning, as investors appear to be focusing in on its rising overhead costs their impact on future earnings. Profits actually fell 3.1% Y/Y, and the company warns that much of its sales growth was driven by discounts or other promotions and competitive conditions remain at high levels.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM
  • IDIX

    Shares of Idenix Pharmaceuticals (IDIX +2.2%) see a flurry of activity on renewed rumors of a...

    Shares of Idenix Pharmaceuticals (IDIX +2.2%) see a flurry of activity on renewed rumors of a takeover - moving from negative to positive territory in minutes. The share movement is following a larger theme in the healthcare sector of Hepatitis C-related stocks exhibiting wild momentum swings up and down - sometimes on just whisps of news.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:39 PM
  • RVBD

    Riverbed (RVBD +5.2%), crushed 10 days ago thanks to the soft guidance that accompanied its Q4...

    Riverbed (RVBD +5.2%), crushed 10 days ago thanks to the soft guidance that accompanied its Q4 report (I, II), is rallying on an upgrade to Buy from Pac Crest's Brent Bracelin. Bracelin is bullish on the potential of Riverbed's just-released Granite product line, which works with Riverbed's bread-and-butter WAN optimization gear to improve remote storage performance for demanding applications.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:33 PM
  • ASRT

    Depomed (DEPO +4.4%) continues to rally after announcing late in the trading day Friday that it...

    Depomed (DEPO +4.4%) continues to rally after announcing late in the trading day Friday that it landed FDA approval for Merck's Janumet. Auriga says the launch of the drug will boost royalty income in 2012 for Depomed and maintains a solid Buy rating on shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:24 PM
  • CBRL

    Cracker Barrel (CBRL -2.6%) slips on a valuation downgrade to Hold from Buy at KeyBanc.

    Cracker Barrel (CBRL -2.6%) slips on a valuation downgrade to Hold from Buy at KeyBanc.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:24 PM
  • WY

    Shares of Weyerhaeuser (WY -3.3%) get hit by a couple valuation downgrades this morning - UBS to...

    Shares of Weyerhaeuser (WY -3.3%) get hit by a couple valuation downgrades this morning - UBS to Sell and DA Davidson to Neutral - following the company's cautious 2012 guidance issued on Friday.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:13 PM
  • CYOU

    Shares of Changyou.com (CYOU -11.1%) take a nasty tumble after the company issues Q1 EPS...

    Shares of Changyou.com (CYOU -11.1%) take a nasty tumble after the company issues Q1 EPS guidance below that of the consensus mark of analysts. The China-based online game developer is still up 11% YTD after catching interest as a stock likely to be held oversold after the rash of Chinese internet company scandals.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:12 PM
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NFLX +0.2%) shares stage a quick turnaround on heavy volume, apparently traced to a...

    Netflix (NFLX +0.2%) shares stage a quick turnaround on heavy volume, apparently traced to a report about the company's potential inclusion in Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) new TV following a Best Buy (NYSE:BBY) survey. Shares had been off sharply following news of a Coinstar-Verizon JV that could provide intense competition for NFLX later this year.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:06 PM | 2 Comments
  • TEVA

    Teva (TEVA -1.1%) trades down on a report that it faces a NIS 2.7B tax bill, with an additional...

    Teva (TEVA -1.1%) trades down on a report that it faces a NIS 2.7B tax bill, with an additional NIS 200M assessment due within a few weeks. In early January, the Jerusalem Tax Authority made an unprecedented tax assessment on the company after a disagreement about its right to an exemption. Separately, Morgan Stanley also cut the shares to Equal Weight today, citing a balanced risk/reward ratio.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM
  • GBG

    Great Basin Gold (GBG -10.2%) dives after providing its Q4 operating update. The miner produced...

    Great Basin Gold (GBG -10.2%) dives after providing its Q4 operating update. The miner produced 20,727 gold equivalent ounces from Nevada trial activities in Q4, down 20% from Q3, while its cash costs per equivalent ounce rose 18%, to $783. Only 6,470 ounces were recovered at a South African mine, roughly flat Q/Q.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:55 AM | 4 Comments
  • DAL

    Delta Air Lines (DAL -2.8%) says January traffic fell 1.5%, its sixth straight monthly decline,...

    Delta Air Lines (DAL -2.8%) says January traffic fell 1.5%, its sixth straight monthly decline, with a 4.3% drop in capacity. Load factor improved to 77.5% from 75.2% a year ago; passenger revenue per available seat mile increased 14.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM
  • PPO

    Polypore (PPO +1.7%) gains on a Baird upgrade to Outperform following the company's conference...

    Polypore (PPO +1.7%) gains on a Baird upgrade to Outperform following the company's conference call on Friday, which they say emphasized its strong technical position and competitive strengths. Needham also noted that Polypore stands to gain significantly from Rockwood Holdings' (NYSE:ROC) recent announcement of plans to double its lithium production capacity.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM
  • RRC

    Range Resources (RRC +1.1%) moves higher after saying it ended 2011 with an improved natural gas...

    Range Resources (RRC +1.1%) moves higher after saying it ended 2011 with an improved natural gas resource base of 44T - 60T cfe, up from 35T - 52T cfe a year earlier. The higher resource potential was fed by production gains from drilling projects in the Marcellus Shale and other U.S. formations in Appalachia, the Midcontinent and West Texas.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM | 1 Comment
  • HITT

    Hittite Microwave (HITT -2.4%) shares are lowered to Hold from Buy at Needham, which cites...

    Hittite Microwave (HITT -2.4%) shares are lowered to Hold from Buy at Needham, which cites concerns that estimates may be revised lower following the radio frequency components maker's upcoming earnings report. Many of HITT's peers are experiencing declines of 20% or more in revenue from wireless infrastructure manufacturers, the firm says.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM
  • AVAV

    Goldman Sachs raises its rating on AeroVironment (AVAV +3.9%) to Buy from Neutral, noting the...

    Goldman Sachs raises its rating on AeroVironment (AVAV +3.9%) to Buy from Neutral, noting the company's "high potential" as a merger and acquisition candidate, above-average returns on capital, exposure to growth markets such as UAVs and electric vehicle battery charging, and an attractive valuation.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM | 1 Comment
  • OREX

    Orexigen Therapeutics (OREX +8.3%) says it reached an agreement with the FDA on details of the...

    Orexigen Therapeutics (OREX +8.3%) says it reached an agreement with the FDA on details of the design and planned analysis for a trial of its diet drug Contrave. The objective of the trial is to demonstrate that Contrave doesn't increase the risk of major adverse cardiovascular events.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM
  • APPCQ

    Shares of American Apparel (APP +12%) ramp higher after the company says total January sales...

    Shares of American Apparel (APP +12%) ramp higher after the company says total January sales jumped 14% to $41M while same-store sales rose 15%. The better-than-expected report marks the fourth-straight month of improvement for the clothing retailer.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM
  • ANRZQ

    Shares of Alpha Natural Resources (ANR +2%) reverse course and are now trading up on the day...

    Shares of Alpha Natural Resources (ANR +2%) reverse course and are now trading up on the day after the miner said on Friday that it's scaling back production at many of its central Appalachian coal mines, citing weakening demand from its electric utility customers.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM
  • HUM

    Humana (HUM -5.3%) dips after its Q4 results missed Street expectations this morning, largely...

    Humana (HUM -5.3%) dips after its Q4 results missed Street expectations this morning, largely due to higher than anticipated acquisition costs. Earnings actually rose 86% Y/Y, as the health insurer benefited from membership growth and light use of health benefits. However, the company lowers its current quarter forecast below analysts expectations, now seeing $1.35 to $1.45 a share versus Street estimates of $1.81.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:32 AM
  • ATRO

    Shares of Astronics (ATRO +8.1%) ride a Q4 earnings beat higher. Highlighting the report was the...

    Shares of Astronics (ATRO +8.1%) ride a Q4 earnings beat higher. Highlighting the report was the firm's 25% Y/Y jump in revenue to $58.2M in its aircraft lighting and electronics business which helped offset a $500K hit from the AMR bankruptcy filing.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM
  • GLW

    Piper Jaffray upgrades Corning (GLW +1.4%) shares to Overweight from Neutral with a raised price...

    Piper Jaffray upgrades Corning (GLW +1.4%) shares to Overweight from Neutral with a raised price target to $16 from $13, asserting that GLW will resume earnings growth next year and perhaps see 19% growth to $1.60 per share, vs. ~$1.35 this year. GLW likely will be more aggressive in its stock buyback, it has $3.4B in net cash and is generating "substantial" free cash flow.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:13 AM | 2 Comments
  • XSPA

    Shares of Vringo (VRNG) shoot 7.7% higher after the firm announces that it passed the 1M...

    Shares of Vringo (VRNG) shoot 7.7% higher after the firm announces that it passed the 1M download mark with its Facetones app that adds social content from Facebook to mobile devices. Trading volume on Vringo passed its daily average within 30 minutes of the market open.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:13 AM
  • CVC

    Cablevision (CVC +2.2%) trades higher as chatter that a large fish will come along to snap up...

    Cablevision (CVC +2.2%) trades higher as chatter that a large fish will come along to snap up the firm picks up steam again. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:53 AM
  • QIHU

    Death by Apple: Shares of China-based Qihoo (QIHU -9.1%) get slammed after Apple removes the...

    Death by Apple: Shares of China-based Qihoo (QIHU -9.1%) get slammed after Apple removes the firm's products from the App Store for reasons that haven't been disclosed yet.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 AM
  • AAPL

    HTC shares fall 5.2% on the Taipei exchange after the once-surging smartphone maker posts Q4...

    HTC shares fall 5.2% on the Taipei exchange after the once-surging smartphone maker posts Q4 results that missed analyst estimates in spite of a November warning. Moreover, in further evidence of Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) and Samsung's dominance of the high-end smartphone space, HTC forecasts Q1 revenue of $2.2B-$2.4B, below a $3B consensus. Competition from Chinese vendors could present another challenge.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:31 AM
  • TEN

    Goldman Sachs adds Tenneco (NYSE:TEN) to its Conviction Buy list with a lofty price target of...

    Goldman Sachs adds Tenneco (NYSE:TEN) to its Conviction Buy list with a lofty price target of $50. Analysts with the firm call for the company to outperform with sales of commercial and light vehicle and see its strong backlog as a positive driver. Shares +1.6% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:19 AM
  • MGM

    MGM Resorts (NYSE:MGM) -2.4% premarket after Goldman Sachs lowers its stock rating to...

    MGM Resorts (NYSE:MGM) -2.4% premarket after Goldman Sachs lowers its stock rating to Neutral from Buy on valuation with shares up 38% YTD. But the firm still believes in MGM's long-term story based on a Las Vegas strip recovery and expects the company to make progress in restructuring its balance sheet.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:17 AM

  • Market preview: Greece once again dominates as members of the governing coalition do their best...

    Market preview: Greece once again dominates as members of the governing coalition do their best to resist more Troika-imposed austerity. EU stocks and U.S. futures are all lower and giving up their gains from Friday, with S&P benchmark futures -0.5%. Following earnings, Hasbro pares early losses but is still -3.1%, Humana is -3.2% and Sohu is -13%. Later: Employment Trends Index
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • ANAC

    Anacor Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ANAC) announces that partner GlaxoSmithKline (NYSE:GSK) has...

    Anacor Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ANAC) announces that partner GlaxoSmithKline (NYSE:GSK) has voluntarily paused enrollment for its clinical trials of its urinary tract infection treatment under development after seeing a "microbiological finding" in a small number of patients. Shares of ANAC -11.1% premarket, GSK +0.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:09 AM
  • SOHU

    More on Sohu.com (NASDAQ:SOHU) earnings: "Increased investment in online video . coupled with...

    More on Sohu.com (NASDAQ:SOHU) earnings: "Increased investment in online video ... coupled with slow seasonality, no doubt will put weight on our short-term financial results," says CFO Carol Yu. The company expects 2012 Q1 revenues to decline to $219M-$225M from Q4's $246M. Shares -13.2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:06 AM
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) take an immediate turn south after news of a Coinstar-Verizon JV hits and...

    Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) take an immediate turn south after news of a Coinstar-Verizon JV hits and investors see the tie-up delivering some heated competition to the company later this year. Shares -3.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:47 AM | 3 Comments
  • VZ

    Verizon (NYSE:VZ) and Coinstar (NASDAQ:CSTR) announce a joint venture that the firms say will...

    Verizon (NYSE:VZ) and Coinstar (NASDAQ:CSTR) announce a joint venture that the firms say will create a subscription service combining new release DVD and Blu-ray rentals with streaming download options. The new product is slated to be introduced in the second half of 2012. Premarket: VZ -0.1%, CSTR +8.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:41 AM
